While not as good as the GoldSRC version it's fine for a playthrough. Here's a tip tho don't use the hd models.

This "remaster" is really bad
Things it improves
Lightning (sometimes)
Physics
Flashlight
Some guns feel better to shoot like the pistol. revolver, shotgun
Skyboxes (except xen)
The stuff that are worse
MP5 has this weird up and down movement while shooting which makes gordon seem like hes just jamming
A lot of bugs, some that can be kinda game breaking
Sometimes the lighting is so much worse than the original half-life
There's this weird effect which makes everything seem shiny af
Basically if u want to play half-life then go with the original one or black mesa
If u already bought half-life source instead of the original one get the half-life source fixed mod which fixes a lot of the issues (although for me it crashes on on a rail so i didnt get past that)
i only recommend getting half-life source if u want to mess around with the maps in gmod
Don't get the source port unless you wanna experience the worst bugs. Please buy the original, you have been warned.

I started playing this when I was 12 but got so scared the first time I encountered the first head crab. I hadn't played until now, 21-years later. It's a masterpiece in every way. Every run-and-gun moment has a smarter alternative, the puzzles are ingenious, and the levels are massive. My only criticism is that some of the puzzle set pieces are difficult to solve or notice without some kind of strategy guide, mostly because of the game's graphical constraints and perhaps, some very minor bugs (or maybe it's because I'm blind). For example, there is a conveyor belt sequence, where the graphics on the top half of that stage doesn't render, and it's impossible to see where you're going (it's a known bug apparently for some machines). Also, there was once a moment when an event didn't trigger after I did what I was supposed do (activate a power generator), so I was wandering the world for hours, until I realized, with the help of an online walkthrough that I indeed did the right thing and I had to go back and redo it.  Aside from these two frustrating moments, the game is a masterpiece that deserves all of its accolades. I wish I had played through it a little earlier. On to Half-Life 2.

Imagine this, you are a Half Life Fan in the 2000's. All you want is a sequel to your favorite game franchise, you expect top of the line graphics, super great story. But what you actually get is a tech demo full of bugs. It displays it self as "REMASTERED" when you get less than the original Half Life. I mean the game is not bad, until you see a scientist floating above is chair, like can someone explain to me how does this not break Newton's physics laws, are these scientists supposed to know the laws of physics??? It's so bad it doesnt look like a source game.

I have experienced more bugs in this game than on my 100 hours run of Cyberpunk 2077 one day after they released it on pc. To get you an idea, every 2 chapters I had to start a new game in the chapter I left off due to some random bug that broke the game by some way. If you are looking to play Half Life, get the original game or Black Mesa.
